document.title: Georgia’s K-12 Standards for English Language Arts (SY2025-2026)

181C0CC3E177425B93F3B43E9E05B7B5.description: Compare and contrast major authors and works of three periods of English and American literary history, including key themes and stylistic features. (I)

81641FC3485C4FA99D3A025CB309B46D.description: Compare and contrast the works of writers and artists who are part of a specific movement during a particular time period. (I)

2F689D0F68BD450AA77D86BDC8289E74.description: Demonstrate knowledge of dominant themes, genres, and verbal styles of literature from a particular time period.

06FF27F5DA1E43E4A1E862FA0E06DCB2.description: Periods & Movements Students demonstrate knowledge of dominant themes, genres, and verbal styles of literature from a particular time period.

8AAC344D01CE4A838F78EB02A4F85505.description: Follow Modern Language Association (MLA) guidelines when responding to inferential questions about texts or when integrating and citing textual evidence, ensuring each source is accompanied by a basic entry on a works cited page. (C)

A767F56B9FDE49AF919FA01239E4F2EB.description: Analyze information from a variety of sources by identifying misconceptions, conflicting information or perspectives, and/or author bias and verifying the validity, relevancy, and accuracy of the information being considered. (I)

D421F388141B4045B81DE64836CC44E2.description: Navigate and use a variety of credible print and digital sources, including academic databases, to locate relevant information about a central argument, topic, or question. (I)

645469FAE1894B099CB0EB6BAAA99ABA.description: Curating Sources & Evidence Reference parts of texts to address a specific topic or question and explore various sources of information to make connections across a broad range of topics.

E36228D8FCBC426D96F96ED5958611B7.description: Integrate paraphrased, summarized, and quoted material into original texts in various ways for intended purposes that strengthen the writing, citing the sources of ideas following the guidelines of Modern Language Association (MLA) format or American Psychological Association (APA) format. (C)

0F42D9ABEA7D47A6A3AE047A448C7902.description: Synthesize information from a variety of credible sources to support a central thesis, citing appropriately. (I)

59E89316370E4311BF3D3DEEAC9F2776.description: Generate questions to guide research, make connections between complex topics, explore creative solutions, narrow focus, and/or refine text creation. (I)

376B90577D024D35AB2AD7BEBD09AC8E.description: Research & Inquiry Conduct research, generating questions to guide investigations of complex topics of interest and using credible sources to support analyses.

DD32BC7C2504498DB1F651BC55466FD2.description: Research & Analysis Students use, discuss, analyze, and curate texts as they engage in various conversations, activities, and projects about a range of grade-level texts and topics.

A6B7B0BFD4D44D22889105732C7197B3.description: Apply knowledge of various poetic techniques and conventions to create poetic text for an intended purpose. (C)

0C8A8990624E45A9A319970C1E6F1C67.description: Read, discuss, evaluate, and critique a variety of poetic texts, considering poetic techniques used to present and design content and their associated implications on meaning and/or theme. (I)

FC5B7B3DC67846EB9AFC57451E683386.description: Poetic Techniques Evaluate and apply poetic techniques to enhance text’s appeal to audiences or achieve specific purposes.

9D3D887CCB8440F09CBEB275F7EAED83.description: Integrate multiple rhetorical devices or appeals strategically. (C)*

4EA9A29E2D9F49819B2B68335A0D9AC3.description: Apply argumentative techniques strategically to enhance writing and engage audiences. (C)

6B565B5A980149039ABBEDDA6717291C.description: Evaluate and critique the use of rhetorical language in a variety of texts. (I)

781A9E4DE8B844BE98B281ABCC9CCAEB.description: Read, discuss, evaluate, and critique a variety of texts, considering the argumentative techniques used to present and design content and their associated implications on meaning or central idea. (I)

AEABDDA18D2D4307B6490B6D8189D7B4.description: Argumentative Techniques Evaluate and apply argumentative techniques to enhance text’s appeal to audiences or achieve specific purposes.

B8433D6930FA40588D86323C51FF38BE.description: Apply expository techniques to develop a cohesive text, organized in a way that clarifies the relationship between ideas, includes multiple and varied types of information, uses multiple text structures, and adjusts tone for a variety of audiences and purposes. (C)

0810EE0A070E4C0B86F2D3F5F2A1E41B.description: Analyze and evaluate texts with conflicting information or opposing viewpoints and determine where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretations. (I)

A0898BFE37834E23A1AF1B0A5A9260D4.description: Evaluate and critique expository techniques and organizational patterns and their effect; evaluate and critique clarity of information and its impact. (I)

321799990AB8423E8D547EAF39C9FE6A.description: Expository Techniques Evaluate and apply expository techniques to enhance text’s appeal to audiences or achieve specific purposes.

0D86CE5FEB0C4048869577BBA8C8F923.description: Effectively apply a variety of narrative techniques to develop complex character(s) who change, use setting to create mood, develop an idea or theme across the text using metaphors and symbolism, achieve specific purposes, engage audiences, and enhance writing. (C)

8CAEC2C9A37F4CA18F27A60882975C2C.description: Analyze how literary works draw on themes, event patterns, or character types from different time periods. (I)

09937A8DC3514F0F8A3F0B47B34C05F8.description: Compare how different authors develop a similar theme, comparing passages within and across texts, providing both reasoning and supportive textual evidence. (I)

76E2F4E303EF4C1984C8F571754716B0.description: Compare and evaluate how multiple authors use plot structures, conflict, narrative devices, word choice, and other craft techniques to impact audiences and create purpose. (I)

24315605785D4106A91F060ECAACD260.description: Evaluate how different authors develop and use narrative techniques (including archetypes, multiple perspectives, plot structure, and symbolism) across texts, using textual evidence. (I)

F6766E2129D7414C83292470C5C0EF38.description: Narrative Techniques Evaluate and apply narrative techniques to enhance text’s appeal to audiences or achieve specific purposes.

14711642A044473E8D8E767E41D40A7D.description: Techniques Students evaluate and apply various techniques to comprehend and shape meaning.

8C0AD764FFAE4BE39845B6A9EF512351.description: Build credibility through a consistent formal, authoritative tone indicative of a confident and knowledgeable expert. (C)

1C732BE529A4446E8E1F6EBBD3512668.description: Use literary devices, figurative language, rhetorical language, and/or rhetorical appeals to create a variety of effects, as appropriate to intended purpose and target audience. (C)

6CD8B0FA2CFA4099A8419201229AAEF0.description: Analyze and evaluate how the use of figurative, connotative, and/or rhetorical language contributes to the development of meaning, tone, or mood in line with the intended purpose. (I)

8E393551068A4F2D9A01CECA46551796.description: Craft Analyze, evaluate, and craft language to produce intended effects in a wide variety of texts.

0F050E40AD78499799411577CC58133B.description: Apply knowledge of text structure and organization to create influential texts with an introduction that guides the focus and promotes a viewpoint; strategically positioned facts, reasons, explanations, details, descriptions, and/or events to shape audience reception; and a compelling conclusion. (C)

47ABE271028F4EBDBEB9D0B9B4342AE0.description: Guide the audience through texts using varied transitions in cohesive multimodal texts, as appropriate for purpose, audience, and design. (C)

8332EED5A9F6416988D947012F8F4EBC.description: Blend multiple organizational structures to support and enhance a text’s central message. (C)

FC41F785918E48C6B63E31814D2C3237.description: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of a text’s organizational structure to meet the needs and expectations of the target audience or serve a specific purpose. (I)

227AC72D2A9043C5B8C39AD0FC8497B2.description: Organization Analyze, evaluate, and use organizational structures and style to shape thoughts across genres.

2D64012E9FF246F384FEDF36A50B1C3A.description: Structure & Style Students analyze and use organizational structures and style to shape ideas and information.

AA026DAB069848018FBEF1C173E2B0A8.description: Synthesize information from a variety of credible sources used to research the answers to questions on academic and individual topics of interest. (C)

2A6B5282802247E4AEF723F174B157C2.description: Evaluate the extent to which historical, disciplinary, and/or personal perspectives affect authors' stylistic and thematic choices in text. (I)

7EE4F56A6A64468DA1EB83FC9749AEEC.description: Locate the original source of questionable content to better evaluate credibility and validity. (I)

862E4B5B87584B51BA19F9685E9DCBA4.description: Compare and contrast varying perspectives on a particular topic found across a variety of texts, analyzing how texts establish and develop perspective to shape perceptions or beliefs. (I)

5EB99C7B8FF743B082AA39492BD440A2.description: Authors & Speakers Evaluate how authors’ and/or speakers’ perspectives influence texts and how circumstances shape their creation.

04D28FFAD31F48BCA93B5F1D40319045.description: Construct and self-evaluate multimodal texts and/or presentations that serve more than one purpose and target a specific audience using multiple, clearly identifiable features of incorporated modes. (C)

82B505351D084F5FB559B303384452C4.description: Evaluate the impact of voice and tone on a text’s reception by the audience. (I)

BA26BA5427544D51B2E04ABAEAAC2063.description: Use knowledge of texts’ distinct disciplinary, personal, or technical purposes to aid comprehension. (I)

6B3297F73B394E1188DE26062B919DB3.description: Purposes & Audiences Analyze the impact of purpose and audience on a wide variety of texts.

17C8EA6738C04E3B9EC8D60A8B963C50.description: Context Students investigate the relationships between authors, purposes, and audiences of texts, and analyze the influence of contextual factors.

7DA7421A1B9848249388C54E1BA07BC5.description: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.

801D9C880D6346BBBFF004A3EFC55B0F.description: Make strategic language decisions when writing or speaking by determining, clarifying, or verifying the nuanced meanings of closely related words or phrases using available print and/or digital resources. (C)

ADEA741DC00B4A158A87CF8589498EB8.description: Use available print and/or digital resources, including reference materials, style guides, digital tools (e.g., online searches, embedded word processing features) to determine, clarify, or verify the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words and phrases. (I)

D0E83893FFC5403FB19605E5E7DE58A4.description: Analyze the nuances in connotative meaning of words that share a similar denotation. (I)

1367C8A57D6D4C678DA13FD142E8FCAB.description: Analyze relationships between words to determine connotative and denotative meanings for words and/or phrases across a variety of contexts. (I)

3901144C62D4412695F263CCE2E0118B.description: Meaning & Purpose Analyze and craft nuanced words and phrases in a variety of texts and for a variety of purposes.

C84836AABEFA4492A0926772C82DD94B.description: Use knowledge of parts of speech to determine precise and effective words and phrases when constructing texts. (C)

372A595030474A5D8CAA2C9CC9644213.description: Construct words based on Greek and Latin roots, root words, and/or affixes and use those words appropriately in context. (C)

D6D2FAE1A6B342CF9D436A6882BD2B67.description: Determine the meanings of words and phrases in context by analyzing the function of parts of speech. (I)

EF5BA1006C8649F8AD4AD02423BF0C9A.description: Deconstruct unknown words or phrases using etymology knowledge, common Greek and Latin roots, root words, and/or affixes to determine meaning as used in grade-level texts. (I)

2E9C9FC86F014EA69E28E5210F282974.description: Word Analysis Use word knowledge and word analysis skills to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words and phrases and to communicate effectively for a variety of purposes.

01B7C1DFF9E342768228FFB2DE8419DC.description: Use grade-level general, academic, disciplinary, technical, and professional vocabulary to communicate clearly and precisely, adjusting style as appropriate in a variety of settings. (C)

5C1D83586CAA49C7A4F32D07C62F490D.description: Acquire a range of general, academic, disciplinary, technical, and professional vocabulary through grade-level print, digital, and/or multimodal texts or content. (I)

90F45231E5F740BC81534AA2862D9A14.description: General, Academic, & Specialized Vocabulary Use expanding vocabulary knowledge to interpret texts and to craft effective communications across a wide variety of real-life, academic, disciplinary, technical, and professional contexts.

0A8D9D1DFCDE49F5BDCA73EFC17FF9D3.description: Vocabulary Students engage in a wide range of written and spoken activities during which they expand and deepen their vocabularies, build word analysis skillsets (morphology), and determine or clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

3CD00A28BF6F4F94936DC61AE5A3E589.description: Use and revise parallel structure across paragraphs or sections to create symmetry and convey a congruence of ideas. (C)

EDD9A5B640BF4C21B024234E46762082.description: Expand and enrich ideas and information, incorporating details and descriptions to achieve specific purposes and facilitate engagement. (C)

124DC95412B14175958448C2B08B25E4.description: Maintain consistent use of active or passive voice throughout a text, as determined by the purpose, audience, and discipline. (C)

49B38CB3112849618D43206D9BB3EA13.description: Compose texts with varied syntax, reshaping sentences for style and effect while maintaining consistency of verb tenses, aspects, and moods. (C)

6CD7B283601148D0B463AE057FB1E616.description: Apply understandings of syntax to comprehend, analyze, and evaluate a wide variety of texts, including evaluating instances of parallel structure. (I)

A553C9BDB6C849508B812805B85E4FCD.description: Syntax Apply understanding of syntax to comprehend, analyze, evaluate, craft, and reshape sentences to achieve desired effects.

9E5BB6E7887D42A18A2A1B849EAAE2C4.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics Draw from knowledge of the conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics when analyzing, evaluating, and constructing texts.

74F569EB5AAD48EC9F3239504AF2A32C.description: Grammar Conventions Students observe, analyze, and use the structures and conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics as they interpret and construct texts.

C31A504050E94AD985A789E8AA80F509.description: Language (L) Students learn and apply the structures and conventions of standard English. Students observe and analyze how grammar works in reading and writing. Students build vocabularies and determine word meanings as they relate to reading and writing.

BA8FEEC72CE345A69F0CE0127358528D.description: Build background knowledge by reciting all or part of significant poems and speeches as appropriate by grade level. (I/C)

5756241AAEF64F45BF3926091EABBE86.description: Engage in dialogue with audiences by asking and answering questions. (I/C)

8359C639A649464EA987F3A7A617E6D6.description: Vary tone, pace, and nonverbal gestures as appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

E428A8312FE44986B1DDE78328B78A1B.description: Integrate modes and genres most appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

8EA8EB1DBBB74770B469783CA557D408.description: Communicate clearly to present ideas, information, and texts. (I/C)

8338BA8C75BE4996991351F78E719F1E.description: Presentation Use presentation skills to tailor communication to target audiences for specific purposes.

0787601C24D14120A33DC286B036305A.description: Work with others to discuss topics, investigate questions, solve problems, and explore and create texts. (I/C)

182EABF7EDC0457EB9B21854876F9F3D.description: Contribute to discussions and shared projects by offering ideas, listening to the ideas of others, and providing feedback. (I/C)

5817984A476A4B05911FA2D2B2BCB141.description: Collaborate with others to determine group norms, establish goals and procedures, and facilitate productivity when working on shared projects. (I/C)

B6F2AC3989A54426A64CFB5A3A08C817.description: Arrive to group discussions and collaborative meetings prepared to be an active participant in the work. (I/C)

19DEA917DDD844BC8BAB061ECA298A12.description: Collaboration Collaborate with others to accomplish shared goals and projects.

5617D02EA3CA4537B697E7C39D06D800.description: Collaboration & Presentation Students build and share knowledge as they engage with others in a range of settings and for a variety of purposes.

3EB7874687324DA8B7E4EFF09F7A2D95.description: Consume and produce multimodal texts, integrating a variety of genres, text features, and craft techniques to influence target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

36D358BD3ADA4259AAE879E7F717F3FB.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact how ideas and information are structured and arranged in texts. (I/C)

28B1240B85D94F51B1B297D8799A0011.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact what kinds of ideas and information are included in texts. (I/C)

85E90B447D484370AD29CE3B64D06ADE.description: Explore and create texts in various modes and genres, developing and applying knowledge of how specific features impact meaning, tone, style, purpose, and audience. (I/C)

3E183FB6545B430FBB04D098B0075D04.description: Text Design Consider the impact of text design on audience and purpose when consuming and producing texts across modes and genres.

C284AE332DD64B62BE3AF4C48F6B6F8D.description: Organize texts by incorporating specific formats, structures, patterns, and features to influence the audience, facilitate accessibility, and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

4AB3C4B8786F40CEBB7AE7463A22B702.description: Make decisions about sentence structure and syntax in order to accommodate and influence the audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

04938E6EA84D4C64951BCC5F3C4E9454.description: Craft words and phrases in order to influence the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions of the target audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

7F2439D49D1944E1B54E9D3DBE4D1009.description: Integrate literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements to appeal to target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

037D6E8A8DFF4F92BA52E2CF0175460B.description: Writing like a Reader Construct texts with the audience’s experience in mind, basing decisions about craft techniques on context and purpose.

E0CF6A40CA004A5E824CD9FBAF1AC8E2.description: Describe, analyze, and evaluate the design and organization of the text, explaining how specific formats, structures, patterns, and features influence the audience, contribute to the text’s accessibility, and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

0E52DBD50C6847AA87AEABB5186DFBBB.description: Explain, analyze, and evaluate how the author’s use of sentence structure and syntax affects the target audience and supports the text’s purpose. (I/C)

243807CAC8484900ABFE7B21D3EB4C3F.description: Identify, apply, and analyze important, interesting, or effective uses of language, explaining or evaluating how specific word choices affect the target audience and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

655F13730D864A4A8C171C295420F29E.description: Identify, apply, and analyze the literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements in texts, explaining or evaluating how specific elements affect the target audience and support the text’s purpose. (I/C)

2146C5A199EC43C3BA1166AE66BB5BAE.description: Reading like a Writer Interpret texts through the author’s lens by identifying, analyzing, and evaluating craft techniques that are connected to the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions triggered by the text.

83B3539EDB30476A898EEB9F4E038015.description: Author’s Craft Students apply knowledge of author’s craft to enhance the interpretation and construction of texts.

76413FFE28BD4899AA2FF7B0073FB965.description: Draw from knowledge of how authors consider context and audience to determine which information and ideas to highlight, which text design is most accessible, which word choices and language structures are most effective, and which craft techniques are most impactful. (I/C)

3B09B9CFD09B44228D7731EB000ED41F.description: Draw from knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish a clear point of view or unique perspective when interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

FE5C1D4059014398A44BB687122F94A7.description: Develop and apply knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish the purpose of texts being interpreted or constructed and to evaluate the extent to which those texts achieve those purposes. (I/C)

ED78067DC9DA431586505FF29913CCD4.description: Author, Audience, & Purpose Interpret and construct texts by developing and applying knowledge of the strategies and techniques authors use to accommodate the target audience and achieve the text’s purpose.

1A72324859344482B659813DBA9D342C.description: Explore how context shapes the author’s decisions and the audience’s responses during the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

53D6A38387BF46A489B90ACCA54E63A2.description: Consider how context impacts the purposes of the author and the audience. (I/C)

98AE86F230124036ADCB188D2E9D9F59.description: Use prior knowledge, formal or informal research, and discussions with others to identify the key components of context that are most relevant. (I/C)

AA17539895D046BA94CE24898596EAB1.description: Context Develop and apply knowledge of key components of context such as background information, geographic location, cultural influences, time period, and contemporary events when interpreting and constructing texts.

6049263CD4EE470DAAC6554DD7F98102.description: Situating Texts Students develop and apply a multilayered understanding of context, author, audience, and purpose to ground and propel the interpretation and construction of texts.

4A6895145A1C4456B6C4B92C70A35A08.description: Edit the text, ensuring it adheres to the conventions of written language. (C)

66F232F3836C411BA21DC2B8AA490CF9.description: Make changes to the text based on self-evaluation or external feedback, revising the organization, ideas, information, word choices, and craft techniques in order to increase the text’s effectiveness. (C)

5BE58FE9D4CA4121B74F35145AD8062F.description: Evaluate the text’s effectiveness based on self-review or feedback from others, determining whether the text matches the purpose and goals for writing. (C)

0DD2DF6CDD074CE8B487923366CE1269.description: Construct an initial draft by integrating ideas and information; selecting words, phrases, and sentences; and incorporating craft techniques that will best achieve the purpose of the text and resonate with the target audience. (C)

AEE97663CE8249229A56C4E33F26771E.description: Link ideas and information to the organization plan, highlighting ideas and information that are most relevant, useful, and impactful. (C)

9575D2D208AD49098A7706997A76122D.description: Generate ideas for content by assessing prior knowledge, gathering information from texts, and engaging in discussions with others. (C)

9E8095540A89494B8AC768FB40E3E00B.description: Plan how to organize the text by selecting modes, genres, and structures that will achieve the purpose and meet the needs of the target audience. (C)

61646FE621A745D8AA39B5C0F8D17EE1.description: Establish a purpose and goals for writing and identify a target audience. (C)

899E2DBA0DE74915AF48429F7C020CBA.description: Writing Processes Compose a range of texts for a variety of purposes and audiences, flexibly engaging in writing processes to plan, draft, evaluate, revise, and edit texts.

20D0C06F5BD24536B16955EFBE266598.description: Determine the meanings of unfamiliar words and concepts by applying knowledge of context and of academic vocabulary and word parts. (I)

B5C427323FBB41238C6924C1C7FB8D45.description: Make, track, and support inferences about different levels of meaning within the text. (I)

FC3F5151AB7F495AA477D7AB96821C0B.description: Make and track predictions about the events and information likely to come next. (I)

A6737004C0AF48EF9FBE432C6ACDB025.description: Summarize and visualize sections of the text to maintain understanding. (I)

1D6874F70CEF420AB1705F0057031078.description: Draw from, compare, build, and integrate prior knowledge with the material in the text, addressing inconsistencies or gaps and adding to knowledge repertoires as appropriate. (I)

438789B4FE714161A0B4D296044AB9B7.description: Scan and skim the text, making note of structures and sections that might be most useful. (I)

42E5ECBBB83B4945B667980CBF56B834.description: Establish a purpose and set goals for reading, monitor comprehension, and adjust as needed. (I)

A9563DE0C7314A0299B73AE942ABD2DB.description: Comprehension Strategies Engage with a range of complex texts for a variety of tasks and purposes, accessing and using strategies for comprehension* before, during, and after reading as part of the meaning-making process.

399E40704D3342B28AF15C77DFC21DE1.description: Consume and produce texts in order to solve problems or influence decisions. (I/C)

EE8DB979DE2649A9B13602D0EB1D54CE.description: Interpret and construct texts to aid the analysis and evaluation of texts and ideas. (I/C)

90F80486D2044ACB8EA95DA6C7312C2D.description: Explain and learn concepts and processes by interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

162FC8D3B2774AF29E1D82D1A2F20E07.description: Make use of texts to build knowledge, develop skills, make informed decisions, and share information and ideas. (I/C)

013EE7DC581C497F89C592F29B050886.description: Share real or imagined experiences by interpreting and constructing texts that tell or include stories. (I/C)

E86C141603BB46038EF437CB5D9B43AB.description: Engagement & Intention Engage in written or spoken dialogue as author and audience for a variety of tasks and purposes, making intentional connections within, between, and beyond texts.

C1EEA65E65D843C59DDC7CABA7B2A49D.description: Develop independence and autonomy as a reader and writer. (I/C)

31FA5B87F1F14E77BAA10ABD0980F7CB.description: Participate in a community of readers and writers by developing group norms, discussing texts, sharing individual writing, listening as others share their writing, and offering and responding to feedback. (I/C)

651862F18AD6408BBD5053A9744F352F.description: Build a repertoire of comprehension and composition skills, strategies, and techniques, drawing from them as needed to aid the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

08ADB94C215D43E3BE0F054603BD9B0B.description: Select, read, and write texts of personal interest and academic relevance to grade-level texts and topics. (I/C)

32F6EAF348464003944E844A20706D03.description: Discuss or write about personal and academic reading and writing preferences, referring to specific techniques, topics, modes, and genres that resonate most. (I/C)

515B087F07C04CD9A3706F86EFF43088.description: Generate, understand, monitor, and discuss personal and academic reading and writing goals, revising as appropriate. (I/C)

41DD618CFC3041A4B7B88A3FCEA5BA3B.description: Reader & Writer Identity Build an identity as a reader and writer, developing a repertoire of resources and tools to continuously expand participation as an active consumer and producer of texts.

EF28C2B888B9428CB65021D6CE6DB5FB.description: Engagement & Intention for Comprehension & Composition Students develop personal and academic identities as readers and writers, approaching texts for a variety of tasks and purposes and engaging in reading and writing processes in order to deepen comprehension and strengthen composition.

789D8FD203B84E8A821F8BFF0DAB7233.description: Practices (P) Students engage routinely in four literacy practices that ground, shape, and inform the expectations of the Foundations, Language, and Texts domains.
